topic.title: Updating RPMs on Version Locked Nodes
topic.shortdesc: At a high level, updating RPMs on a version locked node (Foreman VM, Ceph ICE VM, OpenStack Controller nodes, OpenStack Compute nodes, or Ceph Storage nodes) is to:

ol.li: Identify the RPMs that need to be updated.
Remove them from the version lock list on that node.
Add the updated RPMs back into the version lock list.

body.p: This topic provides detailed information to perform those steps.
body.note: All of the following commands should be run as the root user.

ol.li:
Produce a list of RPMs that are version locked on a node:
Login to a node.
Execute the following command to produce a list of RPMs that are version locked:# yum versionlock list
Identify the RPMs to be updated from the output of the above command.

Remove the selected RPMs from the version lock list:
Execute the following command, substituting VLockListEntry with an RPM name from the output of the versionlock list command above:# yum versionlock delete VLockListEntryThe VLockListEntry must exactly match an RPM name in the output of the yum versionlock list command.
Repeat for each RPM.

Update each of the selected RPMs:
Execute the following command for an RPM, substituting RPMNameWithoutVersion with the name of the RPM without the version number:# yum update RPMNameWithoutVersion
Repeat for each subsequent RPM

Add each of the selected RPMs back into the version lock list:
Execute the following command, again substituting RPMNameWithoutVersion with the name of the RPM without the version number:# yum versionlock add RPMNameWithoutVersion
